H0.text: The immune system is the deficiency associated with one or more chronic diseases in 80 percent of United States residents aged 60 years or older, who will constitute 25 percent of the population by 2050.

H1.text: Respiratory system is the organ system whose deficiencies are linked to the chronic diseases that 80 percent of U.S. adults aged 60 years or older will have by 2050, when 25 percent of the population will be 60 years or older.

H2.text: Cardiovascular system deficiencies are associated with one or more chronic diseases in 80 percent of U.S. residents aged 60 or older, who will constitute 25 percent of the population by 2050.

H3.text: Blood vessels are associated with the chronic diseases that 80 percent of the 60‑year‑olds and older—who will make up 25 percent of the U.S. population by 2050—will have.

A4.text: Atherosclerosis is the precursor to many of these diseases.

A5.text: It is also a risk factor for acute coronary syndromes, which are diseases that are characterised by a sudden deficit of oxygenated blood to the heart tissue.
